title: Phil Neville's son gets call-up for Ireland U19s after impressing at Manchester United
text:
Phil Neville's son Harvey landed his first call-up to Ireland's Under 19 squad on Tuesday ahead of their impending encounter against Denmark.

Despite his famous father being manager of the England women's team and England international himself in his playing days, his son is establishing himself in the Ireland fold.

The 17-year-old midfielder qualifies for Ireland through his mother Julie's side of the family and has played five times for United's Under 18 side so far in the 2019-20 season.

Phil Neville's son Harvey landed his first call-up to Ireland's Under 19 squad

Harvey is a midfielder who has featured five times for Manchester United's Under 18 team

Neville junior is clearly not adverse to taking on a different route to the top compared to father Phil, who also played for Everton as well as United.

Harvey began his youth career on the books of rivals Manchester City before following his dad to Spain when the Neville brothers coached at Valencia.

He signed for Manchester United in 2018. Upon putting pen to paper at Old Trafford, Neville wrote on Instagram: 'I am very proud and excited to have signed for the club I have supported my whole life.'

Harvey's dad, Phil Neville, played for England and is now the England women's manager

Phil Neville took over as manager of the England women's team in January 2018.

This summer, he guided them to the semi-finals of the World Cup before they were defeated by the United States, who were the eventual winners of the competition.

Neville will be the manager of the British women's football team for the 2020 Olympic games in Tokyo.
description: Phil Neville's son Harvey  landed his first call-up to Ireland's Under 19 squad on Tuesday ahead of their impending encounter against Denmark.
